title: Cisco Clean Access Manager sortColumn SQL Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Cisco Clean Access Manager. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw is in the handling of sortColumn URL parameters when constructing SQL database queries. By specially crafting URL parameters, it is possible to influence the SQL queries to gain remote code execution on the affected system.
addtionnal_details: Cisco has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130417-nac
timeline:
2012-07-24 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2013-05-10 - Coordinated public release of advisory
